subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Friday, 08 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Sweden given win after ref attack
Sweden are awarded a 3-0 victory after their Euro 2008 qualifier in Denmark was abandoned.



 
Beckham warned over flight risks
David Beckham's commute from Los Angeles to London could have career-threatening effects on his health, according to experts.



 
Robben close to new Chelsea deal
Arjen Robben's father brushes off reports that he is close to signing for Real Madrid and says the winger is set to sign a new Chelsea deal.








GOLF




Clarke and Monty in Austria exit
Ryder Cup stars Darren Clarke and Colin Montgomerie miss the cut at the Austrian Open on Friday.



 
Ramsay to join Woods in US Open
Scotland's US Amateur champion Richie Ramsay will partner Tiger Woods and holder Geoff Ogilvy in next week's US Open.



 
Green surges into lead in Austria
Australia's Richard Green leads the Austrian Open by one shot at the halfway stage after a second-round 65.








MOTORSPORT




McLaren set early Canada GP pace
McLaren drivers Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton head their Ferrari title rivals in first practice at the Canadian Grand Prix.



 
Hamilton issues warning on 'bias'
Lewis Hamilton says he would leave McLaren if he ever felt the team were favouring team-mate Fernando Alonso.



 
Tragedy mars McGuinness victory
A rider and two spectators die following a crash in the Senior race at the Isle of man TT, in which winner John McGuinness set a new lap record.








FORMULA ONE




McLaren set early Canada GP pace
McLaren drivers Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton head their Ferrari title rivals in first practice at the Canadian Grand Prix.



 
Hamilton issues warning on 'bias'
Lewis Hamilton says he would leave McLaren if he ever felt the team were favouring team-mate Fernando Alonso.



 
McLaren boss feels for Raikkonen
McLaren boss Ron Dennis says he takes no pleasure in former driver Kimi Raikkonen's struggles at Ferrari.








ATHLETICS




Ban 'almost destroyed' Ohuruogu
Christine Ohuruogu's coach Lloyd Cowan says it has been a difficult job to get his charge back on track after her suspension.



 
Tomlinson looking for Osaka boost
British long jumper Chris Tomlinson says he hopes to put his injury problems behind him at this year's World Championships in Osaka.



 
Gebrselassie targets hour mark
Ethiopian distance-running great Haile Gebrselassie will attempt to break the world one-hour record this year.








CYCLING




Tour takes Riis off winners list
Tour de France organisers say they no longer consider Bjarne Riis the 1996 race winner after his drugs confession.



 
Belgian police make doping raids
An assistant from Belgian cycling team Quick-Step is questioned after a series of drugs raids.



 
Thomas toasts 'dream' Tour place
Wales's Geraint Thomas is celebrating a "dream come true" with his ride in next month's Tour de France confirmed.








FUN AND GAMES




Comment: Becks for good
Robbo on Beckham's return for England



 
Ramprakash goes dancing again
Strictly Come Dancing star Mark Ramprakash breaks out a few of his best moves ahead of Surrey's Twenty20 campaign this summer.



 
Hatton gets new nickname
Boxer changing his name to the 'Manchester Mexican'
